intro: Polybotrya cicutaria, commonly known as the slender false hellebore, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in a raceme. It has a fibrous root system and is adapted to dry conditions. The species is part of the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its unique floral structure and medicinal properties.
